basic.floral_language:
Primula beesiana
Floriography: decisive, glorious, optimistic
Primula beesiana is a dwarf plant, broad ovate leaves with a wrinkled surface and toothed edges. Flowers clustered at the top of the leaf blade, like a small bouquet. Has many colors, such as orange, yellow, red, purple, etc. Blooms in early spring, commonly used in flower beds or home decoration.
Primula beesiana likes gentle sunlight, avoid strong sunlight in summer noontime. Flowers in December-April for 1-2 weeks.
basic.blooming: Flowering period December-April, viewing period 1-2 weeks

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Likes sunshine, but avoid summer direct strong light, in summer should be placed under scattered light
maintenance.watering: Water thoroughly when soil is dry, under summer high temperature, reduce water and fertilization
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply 1-2 times monthly in spring and autumn
maintenance.pruning: Remove old, diseased and dead leaves timely
